questions.text: Reynold’s number is used to determine the type of blood flow or the tendency of turbulence. It can tell whether the blood flow is laminar or turbulent or transition. All of the following parameters are used to calculate Reynold’s number except
All of the following statements is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Common carotid artery bifurcates at the level of C2

options.label: B
options.text: In an adult male, larynx extents from C3 – C6 whereas it is still higher in an adult female

options.label: C
options.text: Trachea bifurcates at the level of intervertebral disc between T3 and T4

options.label: D
options.text: Esophagus begins at the level of C6 upper vertebra

questions.correct_answer: B. In an adult male, larynx extents from C3 – C6 whereas it is still higher in an adult female

questions.text: Which one of the following cell types cannot utilize the TCA cycle or electron transport chain?
Which of the following statements is not true regarding the descent of testis?

options.label: A
options.text: Testis is intra abdominal at week 7 of Intrauterine life

options.label: B
options.text: Testis descend down to pelvis at 3rd month of Intrauterine life

options.label: C
options.text: Testis stays near the deep inguinal ring till 7th month of Intrauterine life

options.label: D
options.text: Testis takes 1 month to reach the scrotum from superficial inguinal ring

questions.correct_answer: D. Testis takes 1 month to reach the scrotum from superficial inguinal ring

questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding perforators, except

options.label: A
options.text: Supra ankle cockett’s perforators drain the superficial blood into deeper veins

options.label: B
options.text: Hunterian perforator is present between femoral vein and great saphenous vein

options.label: C
options.text: Dodd’s perforator is present just below knee

options.label: D
options.text: Boyd’s perforator is present between great saphenous vein and posterior tibial / popliteal

questions.correct_answer: C. Dodd’s perforator is present just below knee

questions.text: A Professor was taking anatomy lecture at JIPMER, He then asked a student, what is A? The student wanted to confirm what is E. Professor said E is Scapula. What will be the student’s answer?

Urine formation is a major process in our body which includes several steps like glomerular ultrafiltration, tubular reabsorption and tubular secretion. Which of the substances in our body are filtered, reabsorbed and also secreted?
questions.explanation: URINE→FORMATION Glomerular-Ultrafiltration TubularReabsorption + TubularSecretion

questions.text: A 68-year-old female presented in the emergency room with complaints of dizziness and nystagmus. Examination revealed loss of pain and temperature sensation over the right side of the face and the left side of the body. The patient also exhibited ataxia on the right side in both the upper and lower extremities. The lesion in which structure is responsible for this condition?
questions.explanation:
1. BASILAR ARTERY

PONS

  • Uppermedula
  • Midbrain
2. PICA

Posterior cerebellum

Lateral medulla
3. posterior cerebral artery

posterior cerebrum

Occipital visualcortex/striate cortex

Calcarine sulcus

Midbrain Thalamus
4. Posterior communicating artery Thalamus
5. Anterior Cerebral Artery

Ant.cerebral

Medial cerebrum [major contribution]

Paracentral lobule

Lateral cerebral (pelvis,perineum)
6. Middle Cerebral Artery

Lateral cerebrum [major contribution]

Wernike’s, Broca’s areas maculararea

questions.text: The marked structure is involved in which pathology?

A physician working in a refugee camp in notices a fair number of children with emaciated arms and legs, yet a large protruding stomach and abdomen. An analysis of the children’s blood would show significantly reduced levels of which one of the following as compared with those in a healthy child?
All the following statements are true about Isometric contraction except?

A 20-year-old male is new to your practice, and you notice he has white hair, white skin, and nystagmus. A defect in the metabolism of which one of the following compounds is responsible for this presentation?

There are 23 generations of respiratory tree in our respiratory pathway starting from trachea till the Achilles’ heel of system where the mucociliary clearance is weakest. Clara cell is a special type of cell which is a part of this respiratory pathway. Which among the following statements is false regarding this cell?

options.label: A
options.text: It is present between upper and lower generations

options.label: C
options.text: Surfactant synthesis begins by 20 weeks of gestation

options.label: D
options.text: Surfactant begins to appear by 28-32 weeks of gestation

questions.correct_answer: A. It is present between upper and lower generations

questions.text: Mother of a new born baby complains about some discharge through umbilicus of her baby to the Resident doctor during the morning rounds. The doctor presses the pubic area of the baby gently. The flow of discharge increase up to 2-3 drops, and looks like urinary fluid as shown in image below. What might be the reason for this discharge?

options.label: A
options.text: Amniotic fluid filled in peritoneal cavity

questions.text: Identify B in the given structure.

Gastric secretion aids in digestion of food with the help of various glands which secretes mucus, pepsinogen, HCl and intrinsic factor. Which phase of Gastric acid secretion is inhibited by Neurotensin?

Muller’s maneuver is a converse of Valsalva maneuver which is used to augment the murmurs and filling sound from the right side of the heart. What’s the correct procedure followed while performing Muller’s maneuver?

options.label: A
options.text: Forced inspiratory effort against closed glottis

options.label: B
options.text: Forced expiratory effort against open glottis

options.label: C
options.text: Forced inspiratory effort against open glottis

options.label: D
options.text: Forced expiratory effort against closed glottis

questions.correct_answer: A. Forced inspiratory effort against closed glottis

questions.text: The diaphragm is formed from the septum transversum, pleuroperitoneal folds and some muscular ingrowth from the lateral body walls, and dorsal mesentery of esophagus. Defect in which one of the following shown is picture is responsible for bochdalek diaphragmatic hernia?

On a routine neonatal exam, it is noted that the red reflex is absent in one eye. An MRI shows a tumor blocking the retina. Regulation at which phase of the cell cycle would be affected by the mutation that leads to this tumor?

A premature infant, when born, had low Apgar scores and was having difficulty breathing. A small amount of a lipid mixture into the child’s lungs, which greatly reduced the respiratory distress the child was experiencing. In addition to proteins, which one of the following was included in the lipid mixture?

A patient is suffering from Addison’s disease where there is autoimmune destruction of adrenal gland. One of the clinical features of this condition is more prone to infections. What are the other features that you can expect when you start working up on this patient?

options.label: A

options.label: C

questions.text: A patient presented to your OPD after a road traffic accident with a chief complaint of dyspnea. On examination, while checking the Blood pressure, it was 75/50 mm Hg. It also showed features of Pulsus paradoxus, Muffled heart sounds on ausculation. You finally arrive at a diagnosis of Cardiac tamponade. What would be the JVP findings when you check the patient’s JVP?

options.label: A
options.text: Prominent X descent and Prominent Y descent

options.label: B
options.text: Prominent X descent and Absent Y descent

options.label: C
options.text: Absent X descent and Prominent Y descent

options.label: D
options.text: Absent X descent and Absent Y descent

questions.correct_answer: B. Prominent X descent and Absent Y descent

questions.text: A patient has been diagnosed with Type 1 diabetes in their late teens and is being treated with exogenous insulin, but is not convinced that the patient has Type 1 diabetes, but rather has Type 2 diabetes. A measurement of which one of the following would allow the doctor to determine the correct diagnosis?
A patient presents with fatigue, and a peripheral blood smear reveals a macrocytic, hyperchromic anemia. Which one of the following may account for this type of anemia?

An individual accidentally ingests an overdose of supplements containing chloro- genic acid, a chemical that inhibits glucose- 6-phosphatase. After an overnight fast, this individual, compared with a healthy person, would exhibit which one of the following?

options.label: C
options.text: An increased level of liver glycogen

options.label: D
options.text: An increased level of blood glucose

questions.correct_answer: C. An increased level of liver glycogen

questions.text: If A is sternal attachment, B is vertebral attachment, what is C, D and E?

options.label: A

options.label: B
options.text: Caval hiatus, Aortic hiatus, Esophageal hiatus

options.label: C
options.text: Aortic hiatus, Caval hiatus, Esophageal hiatus

options.label: D
options.text: Aortic hiatus, Esophageal hiatus, Caval hiatus

questions.correct_answer: D. Aortic hiatus, Esophageal hiatus, Caval hiatus

questions.text: In the pedigree shown below, what is the most likely mode of inheritance?

When a continued stimulus is given to a receptor, the response from the receptor stops over time to prevent cerebral cortex from working. But, when it is removed, brief response from the receptor is noted. Which of the receptor is an example for Rapidly adapting?
questions.explanation:
TYPES

1.RAPIDLYADAPTING/PHASICRECEPTORS

  • PACINIANCORPUSCLE
  • Phasicreceptor
  • Mechanoreceptor
  • Bestsuitedforvibration

2.SLOWLYADAPTINGRECEPTOR

  • MERKELRECEPTOR
  • Helps in continuously sending the important sensory information

3. NONADAPTING/TONICRECEPTOR

  • Do not adapt
  • Helpstocarry the very important sensory information
  • Ex:PAIN RECEPTOR

questions.text: A teenager has developed a goiter, due to a dietary deficiency. Which one of the following would be expected in the case of this dietary deficiency?

A 35 year old female came in due to complaint of fatigue along with numbness in her fingers and toes. When you tried to check her blood pressure, you noticed her fingers started to flex towards her wrist. You also noted that her serum Calcium levels are 7.3 mg/dl. You suspect the patient to have hypocalcemia, which of the following is not true regarding this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: ECF Ca2+ is necessary for stability of Na+ channel gating

options.label: B
options.text: Hypoparathyroidism can be a primary cause of this condition

options.label: C
options.text: Na+ channel gating is stable and with faint stimulus

options.label: D
options.text: Na+ channels open and remain activated which is the reason for Trousseau’s sign

questions.correct_answer: C. Na+ channel gating is stable and with faint stimulus

questions.text: All of the following are examples of loose connective tissue, except?
questions.explanation:
Loose Dense
a. Areolar tissue Dense regular tissue
b. Adipose tissue Dense irregular tissue
c Reticular tissue Elastic tissue

questions.text: All are true about sickle cell disease, except ?

options.label: B
options.text: Heterozygous individuals are at increased risk of Plasmodium falciparum infection

options.label: D
options.text: Hydroxyurea is used as a therapeutic agent

questions.correct_answer: B. Heterozygous individuals are at increased risk of Plasmodium falciparum infection

questions.text: A 21-year-old patient having persistent allergic rhinitis, asthmatic episodes with peripheral hypereosinophilia. Histological findings are shown below. What is your diagnosis?
Breast carcinoma is most likely with which of the following conditions?

A 35-year-old woman present for regular health check-up. She denies any current medical problem except the fact that she remembers being hospitalize for throat infection as a child. Examination reveals normal vitals. On physical examination, normal S1 and S2 with late rumbling diastolic murmur was heard at apex and is enhanced by expiration. Which of the following skin lesion may have accompanied the illness?
questions.explanation:
JO JOINTS Large joint → Migratory polyarthritisNonerosive arthritis (Painful): TX: - Aspirin

questions.text: All of following statements about 6-mercaptopurine are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is metabolized by xanthine oxidase

options.label: C
options.text: Its dose should be reduced when allopurinol is given concurrently

options.label: D
options.text: It is an active metabolite of azathioprine

questions.correct_answer: B. It does not cause hyperuricemia

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman presented with an anterior neck mass. Imaging showed a solid and cystic lesion anterior to the hyoid bone. On subsequent investigations, malignancy was confirmed. A subsequent total thyroidectomy and combined Sistrunk procedure were performed. Histopathological picture is shown below. Which of the following is not a feature of the disease described?

A 35-year-old woman complains of nipple discharge and irregular menses of 5 months duration. Physical examination reveals a milky discharge from both nipples. MRI shows an enlargement of the anterior pituitary. Which of the following is the most likely histologic diagnosis of this patient’s pituitary tumor?

A normally healthy 9-year-old boy presents with a fever, cough, and lower respiratory symptoms (no upper respiratory tract symptoms). He has been ill for 4 days. His chest sounds are consistent with pneumonia, so a chest radiograph is obtained. The radiograph shows small, patchy infiltrates with hilar adenopathy. His blood smear shows small, nondescript yeast forms inside monocytic cells. What is the most likely causative agent?

A 2 year old boy with no past medical history presented to the emergency department with fever and 2 days of bloody diarrhoea and severe abdominal cramps. On examination the boy looked very dehydrated. The stool culture showed Gram negative bacilli, non motile with no H2S production. Which of the following is the most likely organism responsible for this condition?
questions.explanation:
Presentation Identification features
Vibrio cholerae Watery diarrhea
  • Dartingmotility
  • Coma-shaped Gram –negative bacilli in culturesmear
  • Catalase and oxidasepositive
  • TCBS agar: sucrose fermenting yellow coloredcolonies
  • ICUT tests:I+C+U-TSI·
  • Agglutinates with Vibrio cholerae 01 antisera andOgawa antisera
Shigella Dysentery
  • Gram –ve bacilli,non-motile
  • Catalase +ve oxidase–ve

  • MAC or DCA: NLFtranslucen
  • XLD: red colonies without blackcenter
  • ICUT test: I- C+ U-TSI
  • Agglutinates with Shigella polyvalent antisera andspecific monovalentantisera
Group B Salmonella Inflammatory diarrhea
  • Gram –ve bacilli,motile
  • Catalase positive, oxidase–ve
  • MAC: non-lactose fermenting translucentcolonies
  • DCA: non-lactose fermenting colonies with blackcenter
  • XLD: red colonies with blackcenter
  • ICUT tests: I- C+ U- TSI (alkaline slant/ acidic butt, gas,H2S)
  • Agglutinates with Salmonella poly-O antisera andserotype (O4)specific

A patient came in with complaints of myalgia, and evening rise in temperature. Peripheral smear was done that shows the following findings. Comment on the diagnosis.
All of the following are complete sterilizing agents, except:

A 35 year old male patient, came in with the complaint of upper abdominal pain and burning sensation, and halitosis. Endoscopy was done showing an ulcer at the first part of duodenum and urease test turns positive. You would mention that all of the following are true about the causative organism, except?

options.label: A
options.text: It is indicated in all patients of peptic ulcer

options.label: B
options.text: Resistance to any single antimicrobial drug develops rapidly

options.label: C
options.text: Concurrent suppression of gastric acid enhances the efficacy of the regimen

options.label: D
options.text: Colloidal bismuth directly inhibits H. pylori but has poor patient Acceptability

questions.correct_answer: A. It is indicated in all patients of peptic ulcer

Which of the following protease inhibitors has an active metabolite and its bio-availability is not substantially improved with the addition of ritonavir?
VZV vaccine is prepared from which of the following viral strains?

options.label: A
options.text: Edmonston-Zagreb strain grown on human diploid cells

options.label: B
options.text: OKA strain grown on human diploid cells

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: Application of separate screening tests for a single disease

options.label: B
options.text: Application of two or more screening tests in combination at one time

options.label: C
options.text: Application of two or more screening tests in combination at different time

questions.correct_answer: B. Application of two or more screening tests in combination at one time

questions.text: What is the correct sequence In order of occurrence?

A patient presented with complains of enlarged lymph nodes, difficulty in breathing and tonsillar pseudomembrane formation. The patient also added that his family members are also suffering from this condition. The physician decided to check the immune status of the patient and recommended Schick's test. Which of the following statements is/are false regarding Schick’s test ?

options.label: A
options.text: Erythematous reaction in both arm indicates hypersensitivity

options.label: B
options.text: Positive test means that person is immune to Diphtheria

options.label: D
options.text: Test done to find out immune status against diphtheria

A 30-year-old woman is admitted to the hospital with complaints of fever. She was recently diagnosed with acute leukemia and finished a course of chemotherapy last week. As a result of her treatment, she now has essentially no white blood cells. As a part of her workup, 2 blood cultures, a sputum culture, a urine culture, and a chest X-ray was performed. Of all of these tests, the only positive result is one blood culture growing a Gram-Positive Bacillus. What is the most likely cause of the fever?

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: C. The attributable risk of breast cancer resulting from the pill may be directly measured.

questions.text: A 14 year old female came into your OPD around 2 am with symptoms of dyspnea, orthopnea. Intermittent < 2 d / week None N (> 80%) Step 1

Mod. Persistent Daily Some limitation 60 - 80% Step 3
Severe persistent All through day Extreme limitation < 60% Step 4 or 5

options.label: B

Component - II Component - II

Apply tourniquet and ask the patient to stand

↓

Remove tourniquet in standing position

↓ Release the pressure

Rapid filling from above

↓

Incompetent SFJ

Apply the tourniquet

↓

Ask the patient to stnd

↓

Slow filling from below

↓

Incompetent perforators

questions.text: Juvenile dermatomyositis (JDM) is the most common inflammatory myositis in children. It is characterized by skin rash and proximal muscle weakness. All of the following are the common cutaneous manifestations of JDM, except:

options.label: C
options.text: Facial erythema sparing the nasolabial folds

questions.correct_answer: C. Facial erythema sparing the nasolabial folds

questions.text: Identify the marked structure:

A 23 year old male came in due to fever, chest pain, cough, dyspnea for the past 1 week. He visited the hospital as he was not relieved by medications. Auscultation showed dullness in the middle and lower lobe of right lung. CXR showed pleural effusion. After pleural tap, the exudate was sent to the lab which revealed gross appearance of Turbid to purulent, RBC - 4000/mcL, WBC – 95000 P cells/mcL, Glucose less than serum levels. What might be the possible cause in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Etiology or type of Effusion Gross appearnce White Blood cell count (Cells/ mcL) Red Blood cell count (Cells/ mcL) Glucose Comments
Malignancy Turbid to bloody: occasionally serous 1000 to < 100,000 M 100 to several hundred thousand Equal to serum level: < 60 mg / dl. In 15% of cases. Eosinophilia uncommon; positive result on cytologic examination
Uncomplicated parapneuimonic Clear to turbid 5000 - 25,000 p < 5000 Equal to serum levels Tube thoracotomy unnecessary
Emphysema Turbid to purulent 25,000 - 100,000 P < 10,000 Equal to serum levels: occasionally < 60 mg/dL. Protein > 4.0 g/dL); eosinophils cells (> 10%) or mesothelial cells (>5%) make diagnosis unlikely : see text for additional diagnostic tests
Rheumatoid Turbid: greenish yellow 1000 - 20,000 M or P < 1,000 < 40 mg/dL Secondary emphysema common; high LD, low complement, high rheumatoid factor, cholesterol crystal are characteristic

questions.text: Most stable wave of BERA is:

Further history confirmed that he had been having low grade fever at night for the past few weeks and night sweats and involuntary weight loss over 6 months. On ausculation, you find Pericardial friction rub. ECG findings show concave ST elevation, T wave inversion. You confirm the diagnosis as TB pericarditis and start ATT for 6 months. What’s the complication of a treated case of TB pericarditis?

A 21 year old male came in due to complaint of low back pain for the past 6 months. He claims that the pain usually subsides after taking analgesics, but recently there is no improvement. He says that the pain is more after waking up in the morning which bothers him so much that he couldn’t go for work. On examination, tenderness was noted at sacroiliac joint and buttock atrophy was noted with limitation in lateral bending. Further tests revealed HLA B27 +, X ray spine is given below, what is the most common cause of death in this condition?

questions.text: Identify the wrong pair:

A patient was brought to the emergency room after a road traffic accident, the patient had facial trauma and a dislocation a DIP of 2nd toe was noted. FAST was negative for blood collection. GCS – 7. B.P – 90/60 mm Hg. Airway was cleared right away and intubation was done. What might be causing exsanguination leading to shock in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: External blood loss on the floor at the site of accident

questions.text: A 23 year old P1L1 woman presents to the clinic for advice regarding natural methods of contraception and safe days for intercourse. The doctor explains about cervical mucous method and examines her cervical mucous under a microscope after smearing it on a slide. The mucous shows a pattern that is suggestive for high estrogen state. Which of the following mucus findings is associated with estrogen?

A primigravida gets a routine ultrasound with antenatal doppler done at 30 weeks. Her fetal parameters correspond to 30 weeks and umbilical artery S/D ratio is 2.8. She is advised to continue with her prenatal supplements and daily fetal movement counts. She returns after 4 weeks and the ultrasound is repeated. She has no high risk factor and is perceiving fetal movements well, what is the S/D ratio in umbilical artery expected at this visit?

options.label: D
options.text: Constant at 2.8 with a diastolic notch

questions.text: Surgeries done in which zone of the hand causes poor results?
What is the type of hair loss depicted in this image?
What is the treatment of choice for the disorder depicted in the following image?

A 29 year old drug addict and alcoholic was brought to emergency department for severe abdominal pain in the right upper quadrant. The patient also complained of body pain, pruritus and numbness in the extremities. On clincial examination, Palmar erythema, pedal edema and clubbing were noted. What is the investigation of choice in this patient?
In which of the following conditions is refeeding syndrome not seen?

A 19 year old male came to emergency due to severe agonizing pain over his right testes. He also had an episode of vomiting. On examination, High riding in upper part of scrotum was noted. Cremasteric reflex was absent. What is the investigation of choice in this condition?
All of the following are true regarding Irritable Bowel Syndrome when compared to Inflammatory Bowel disease except?
questions.explanation:
IBD IBS
Increased Fecal calprotectin levels Normal range
Bleeding always(+) Not seen
Sleep deprived due to colicky pain Rare
Malnutrition seen Not seen
(-) Pain ↑ anxiety
(-) Exaggerated with menses in female
(-) Noctornal diarreha (+)

questions.text: A 38-year-old female presents to the clinic regarding contraception counseling for using the vaginal diaphragm. The gynecology professor explains to her various methods of contraception. She also sequentially explains the causes of the failure of contraception. Then she demonstrated the insertion technique and taught about the use of barrier contraceptives to her. According to the expert gynecologist’s opinion, when should the vaginal diaphragm be removed?
questions.correct_answer: B. At least 6 hours after intercourse

questions.text: Which of the following statements is not correct about the image given below?

options.label: A
options.text: It’s the Miller laryngoscope. It is the most common type of curved laryngoscope blade

options.label: B
options.text: It is used for pediatric intubation

options.label: C
options.text: The most common complication of this procedure is a sore throat,

options.label: D
options.text: MC position for this procedure is the Reverse Trendelenberg

questions.correct_answer: A. It’s the Miller laryngoscope. It is the most common type of curved laryngoscope blade

questions.text: A 25 years old female came to ENT OPD with complaints of B/L hearing loss and also complaints of better hearing whenever she is in the market with her husband. On further examination a flamingo pink color of tympanic membrane is seen. W hat is the most likely diagnosis?
Most common cause of occipito-posterior presentation:

An 8 weeks pregnant woman presents for routine ultrasound. USG is suggestive of a live intrauterine pregnancy of 8 weeks with a 3 cm right ovarian simple cyst. Which of the following is the most appropriate management ?

options.label: B
options.text: No treatment required, with follow up

options.label: D
options.text: Remove at time of cesarean section

questions.correct_answer: B. No treatment required, with follow up

questions.text: A 45 year old male presents with chest pain, dizziness, altered mental status and CHF features. On examination, HR is 55 bpm, BP 112/68 mm Hg. ECG shows increased R-R interval. You diagnose the case as Symptomatic bradycardia. What is the first Step of management?
questions.correct_answer: C. IV Atropine 1 mg every 3-5 minute

questions.text: 40 year old female presented to your OP with ptosis, double vision, weakness of arms and legs and difficulty speaking. You suspect that the patient might have Myesthenia Gravis. Which feature of Myesthenia Gravis differentiates it from Lambert Eaton Myesthenic Syndrome?

options.label: A
options.text: Ach release decreases but receptor is normal

options.label: B
options.text: Deep tendon reflexes decreases compared to LEMS

options.label: D
options.text: Anti musk antibody is responsible for the symptoms

questions.correct_answer: D. Anti musk antibody is responsible for the symptoms
questions.explanation:
Myasthenia Gravis LEMS
Ach release normal but receptor defective Ach release decreases but receptor normal
Anti Ach R Antibody anti musk antibody Anti P/Q antibody against calcium channel
Female Ptosis, Diplopia chewing muscle weakness Ptosis, diplopia, proximal muscle weakness
DTR Normal DTR Decreased, autonomic features
Decremental response Incremental response
D.O.C pyridotigimene/ steroids D.O.C. 3, 4 diamino pyridine (Pyridostigmine can also be used)

questions.text: A 45 year old female patient on examination of her breast a 4.5 cm x 3cm size irregular mass is felt in the Left upper quadrant of the Right breast which is not fixed to the pectoralis major muscle and no skin changes, a 2cm x 1.5cm lymph node is also palpated in the Right axilla. No mass felt in the opposite breast. What all investigations will you do to this patient? Mammography PET Scan Biopsy of the breast mass USG guided biopsy of the enlarged axillary LN
This change was observed in the capnograph in patient under general anesthesia in midsurgery. What is the most likely cause?
A newly born infant to a healthy mother with no history of illness has an abnormal cry at the time of his birth. He is having difficulty in breathing. What is the most likely cause?
